column1: Overall, I find this to be a very good set. This is a great set. I

column1: ,TRUE,5,2,3,5,2 Odeinoichus","2018-08-20T03:39:07.443Z","Fallen Kingdom Delivers more Dinosaur Fun.","
column13: > Ah, it is nice to once again discuss LEGO Jurassic World. Fallen Kingdom has hit with mixed results for many, and LEGO includes a brand new batch of sets based around the premise of this new film, this fanciful set represents a scene that was never depicted in the actual film, but it fits in quite nicely with the overall theme of Jurassic World and includes another nice looking vehicle.

column8: >Box: The new box design for this second batch of LEGO Jurassic World sets (Not Fallen Kingdom because the sub-title is not included on the box, though obviously meant to be based around the second film in the Jurassic World Trilogy.) features a metallic looking cage design around the outer border of the box and features some similar elements from the original boxes.

>Chief among these is found on the box, where the Dinosaurs are showcased with small blueprint looking images that indicate how the creatures are built. The action shots on the front and back of the box look great and I enjoy seeing these shots because they do a wonderful job of showcasing the set. In the upper corner is a shot of an erupting volcano with LEGO Owen and Blue in the foreground.

>Instructions: Sharing the design of the boxes, the manual shows how to build the model step-by-step and includes some very nice cross-promotional images in the back for LEGO City, Ninjago and Jurassic World. Collect all the Dinosaurs page is also included, though the images do not include the Dilophosaurs or the Raptor from the Jurassic Park inspired set.
>Included in this set are some nice bley parts to match up with the previous film&rsquo
column9: s release of sets, one of the new net launchers, the Pteranodon parts and an Egg Piece. There are some new parts that I haven&rsquo
column10: t seen before as well, 1x2 square tiles with two studs on top and smooth for the rest, similar to the larger 1x3 pieces we&rsquo
column11: ve seen in the past in some sets.

column8: >Owen: Owen has changed his wardrobe for the second film and this Minifigure reflects this, his pants are pretty much the same as the original Owen character, but they are no on a blue pair of LEGO legs and not grey, but the print is the same. His torso is also sporting a darker shirt which is more unkempt looking and open around the collar, but the vest jacket he&rsquo
column9: s wearing is the same brown colour with completely different pocket detailing.

column8: >The facial prints have changed as well, he has a very similar looking design for his stubble and eyebrows. His expressions are different though, one side is a similar looking smile to the next while the reverse expression is a scowling look. He has a new hair piece which was first used for Star-Lord if I&rsquo
column9: m not mistaken. He comes with the same tranquilizer gun first seen in LEGO Jurassic World.

column8: >Pteranodon: The red pattern print detailing is identical to the original version of this creature, but the secondary colour has changed from a dark grey to a lighter pea-soup green looking colour. That or possibly some shade of tan, it&rsquo
column9: s a new colour and looks great to differentiate the two versions released between the two films.

column8: >Tracker: No longer a member of ACU, this Minifigure is very similar to the ACU generic characters from the first film. Her clothes is the same blue tone and her dark vest has a lot of similar pouches and belts printed over it, this is a generic torso though, not gender specific. She is female though as her head is shared between the female ACU from the first film and other characters. I think the print first appeared on Pepper Potts from Iron Man 3.
>She has no accessories unfortunately, but the vehicle she drives include a LEGO wrench for repairs if you want to give her one.

>A very straight-forward build with this set giving us some very nice and effective techniques to make a fairly bulky looking jeep. Detailing relies on stickers for the license plates and other items of detailing such as the Jurassic World logo. The Pterandon head comes in a separate little box with plastic tray&hellip
column9: I do not recall if the original set featuring the Pteranodon included this, I think it was just in a plastic baggie, but I could be mistaken.

column8: >No numbered bags, dump it all out and built it as is, or separate the parts by colour and use if you&rsquo

>The vehicle is a 4X4 style all-terrain trapper, it includes a net launcher which functions quite nicely and is a bit of a boxy vehicle similar to the one seen in one of the Marvel Super Hero sets from recent years&hellip
column9: I think it looks quite similar to the build from the Captain America Civil War set featuring Bucky and the Black Panther.

column8: >It matches the colours of Jurassic World vehicles found in the first years&rsquo
column9: worth of sets from this theme and will make an excellent addition to the display of the entire Jurassic World LEGO universe, it is unfortunate that this vehicle does not appear in the film at any point so it unfortunately isn&rsquo
column11: s very fun to play with though.

column8: >Compared to the set from the first Film&rsquo
column9: s releases in this price range, the Pteranodon Chase is a questionable one due to the fact that the scene depicted here of tracking down a Pteranodon and making off with her egg is not accurate to the film in the slightest. Nothing like that happens in Fallen Kingdom.

column8: >That being said this is a great little set with some nice interesting pieces and a very fun little vehicle to play with, it also features another Pteranodon for your dinosaur collection at a relatively cheap price. A small nest, or an extra vehicle like a Motorcycle for Owen to ride may have been welcome here, but I&rsquo
column9: d still recommend this set if you&rsquo
column10: re a fan of the LEGO Jurassic World theme and are interested in getting everything LEGO Jurassic World. Highly Recommended for fans. Marginally recommended for casual collectors who would prefer something a bit more exciting for their models.

column1:
,TRUE,4,4,3,3,4 LegoHobbitFan","2019-08-25T15:47:32.027Z","Pteranodon chase","

This Jurassic World set has 126 pieces and costs about $20. This means that the price per piece is 15.9 cents, normally not a great deal. Of course, the reason for this is that the set contains a pteranodon in a nice olive green and dark red color scheme. It is very well molded and has excellent printing. Beyond this there is a small truck to chase it and two minifigures
column2: Owen Grady and a generic female tracker. Both minifigures are nice, but owen is pretty common and the tracker is nothing special. The truck contains a net-shooting cannon intended to trap the dino, but it doesn&#39
column3: t work very well. The rest of the truck is pretty nice, it only has about 100 pieces so is fairly straightforward and simple. It nonetheless is a pretty neat model. However it alone is not worth the price, so the only real reason to buy the set is for the pteranodon. I hope you find this review helpful!
